name: Los Angeles
fun_fact: Fun fact: LA has 30% of all Mexican restaurants in the USA, and legendary taco spots like Angel's Tijuana Tacos are so authentic you have to order in Spanish because they don't speak English - and you have to follow them on social media to find where they park each night!

hero_dishes.name: Al Pastor Tacos
hero_dishes.description: Marinated pork carved from vertical trompo spit, topped with pineapple
hero_dishes.origin_story: Lebanese immigrants brought shawarma technique, adapted with Mexican spices
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Leo's Tacos Truck (12 trucks citywide), Angel's Tijuana Tacos

hero_dishes.name: Carnitas
hero_dishes.description: Pork confit in its own fat until crispy outside, melting inside
hero_dishes.origin_story: Traditional preparation that few places still do old-fashioned way
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Carnitas Los Gabrieles in PiÃ±ata District downtown

hero_dishes.name: Sonoran-Style Carne Asada Tacos
hero_dishes.description: Grilled beef tacos on special Sonoran flour tortillas
hero_dishes.origin_story: Sonoratown owners drive 5 hours to Arizona-Mexico border for authentic flour

hero_dishes.name: Lamb Barbacoa
hero_dishes.origin_story: Traditional Mexican preparation from Hidalgo region
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Aqui es Texcoco in Commerce (featured on Bizarre Foods)

signature_drinks.name: Agua Fresca
signature_drinks.description: Fresh fruit waters - horchata, jamaica, tamarind
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: From taco trucks and Mexican restaurants

signature_drinks.name: Michelada
signature_drinks.description: Beer with lime, salt, and chili
